aboutText: Capitalism is in crisis. Society is rapidly polarising between Left and Right. Marxism Festival 2019 is the place to debate how we can beat back the rise of racism, fascism & the far right. But thousands of people from around the world will also be discussing the alternative to the system that means chaos.
pricingText: Advance tickets are much cheaper than those bought on the door. The festival is a not-for-profit event and we keep ticket prices as low as possible. But we do have to charge for entry to cover the high costs of the venues, creche, staffing and accommodation.
emailText:
You can follow us on facebook, twitter and instagram for the latest updates about the event. You can see the timetable here.

Marxism Festival starts on Thursday 4 July and finishes on Sunday 7 July.

We are at a brand new venue this year - the People's Palace at Queen Mary University, Mile End campus, E1 4NS. The nearest tube is Mile End

Your ticket will be sent to you in the post nearer the event.

If you need any more information please get in touch with us on info@marxismfestival.org.uk or call 020 7840 5620.
contactLine2: Do not hesitate to drop us a line. Tel : 020 7840 5620

speakers.name: Mark Serwotka
speakers.shortDescription: Mark Serwotka is General Secretary of the Public and Commercial Services Union (PCS).

speakers.name: Marcia Rigg
speakers.shortDescription: Marcia Rigg is the sister of Sean Rigg, who died in policy custody. She is a Black Lives Matter campaigner.

speakers.name: Ilan Papp
speakers.shortDescription: Ilan is the director of the European Centre for Palestine Studies at the University of Exeter and the author of twenty books, the last one is The Biggest Prison on Earth: a History of the Israeli Occupation.

speakers.name: Extinction Rebellion
speakers.shortDescription: Activists from the Extinction Rebellion campaign will be joining a panel on System Change not Climate Change

speakers.name: Kevin Courtney
speakers.shortDescription: Kevin is joint General Secretary of the National Education Union and will be joining a special panel marking 40 years since the murder of Blair Peach: fighting fascism then and now.

speakers.name: Louise Raw
speakers.shortDescription: Louise is an author, historian and anti-fascist activist. Her books include Striking a Light: The Bryant & May Matchwomen.

speakers.name: Ian Angus
speakers.shortDescription: Ian is an environmental activist and author, and editor of Climate and Capitalism

speakers.name: Sheila Coleman
speakers.shortDescription: Sheila is part of the Hillsborough Justice Campaign and will speak as part of a panel on Injustice and the British state

speakers.name: Michael Roberts
speakers.shortDescription: Michael is a Marxist economist who blogs at https://thenextrecession.wordpress.com/

speakers.name: Nita Sanghera
speakers.shortDescription: Nita is the Vice President of the University and College Union (UCU), and has been active campaigner in defence of education & against racism

speakers.name: Ben Jamal
speakers.shortDescription: Ben is the Director of the Palestine Solidarity Campaign and will be joining a debate on Why Palestine is still the issue

speakers.name: Christine Buchholz
speakers.shortDescription: Christine Buchholz is an MP for Die Linke in Germany and has been involved in anti-fascist and anti-racist campaigns

speakers.name: Nur Masalha
speakers.shortDescription: Nur is a Palestinian writer and academic, and author of the recent book Palestine: a Four Thousand Year History.

speakers.name: Moyra Samuels
speakers.shortDescription: Moyra is a member of the Justice4Grenfell campaign and two years on from the Grenfell tragedy will be part of a panel on Injustice and the British state.

speakers.name: Robin Blackburn
speakers.shortDescription: Robin is a historian and former editor of New Left Review and will be speaking on The dilemmas of pension fund socialism

speakers.name: Naomi Wimbourne-Idrissi
speakers.shortDescription: Naomi is a member of Jewish Voice for Labour and a pro-Palestinian activist

speakers.name: Daniel Kebede
speakers.shortDescription: Daniel is an anti-racist activist and is the Black Members Rep for the National Education Union.

speakers.name: Ian Hodson
speakers.shortDescription: Ian, President of BFAWU, and strikers from McDonalds will be part of many panels debating Corbyn, Labour and the future of British politics

speakers.name: Naima Omar
speakers.shortDescription: Naima is an activist with Stand Up to Racism and will lead a panel discussing A womans right to choose: defending the Hijab.

speakers.name: Alex Callinicos
speakers.shortDescription: Alex Callinicos, author of the Revolutionary Ideas of Karl Marx.

speakers.name: Mark Perryman
speakers.shortDescription: Mark is author of The Corbyn Effect and has a new book in September titled Corbynism From Below.

themes.name: Corbyn
themes.shortDescription: Jeremy Corbyn, the Labour Party and the fight for socialism
themes.longDescription: Jeremy Corbyn's success at last year's general election shattered the Tories and transformed the political situation here in Britain. Meetings at Marxism Festival will debate the issues facing Corbyn and Labour and discuss how we can mobilise to bring about fundamental change.
themes.readMore:
Jeremy Corbyn's success at last year's general election shattered the Tories and transformed the political situation here in Britain. Meetings at Marxism Festival will debate the issues facing Corbyn and Labour and discuss how we can mobilise to bring about fundamental change.

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: Racism
themes.shortDescription: Resisting the racist backlash and the rise of fascism across Europe
themes.longDescription: Far right and fascist forces have grown across Europe and the bigoted presidency of Donald Trump adds to the instability across the globe.  Meanwhile hundreds of refugees continue to die as they flee war and persecution. At Marxism Festival we will discuss how best to respond to these challenges.
themes.readMore:
Far right and fascist forces have grown across Europe and the bigoted presidency of Donald Trump adds to the instability across the globe. Meanwhile hundreds of refugees continue to die as they flee war and persecution. At Marxism Festival we will discuss how best to respond to these challenges.

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: Marx
themes.longDescription: Karl Marx was an anti-capitalist and revolutionary. But 200 years on from his birth are his ideas still relevant today? We will explore Marx's economic insights for a system in crisis as well as his method for understanding the world today.
themes.readMore:
Karl Marx was an anti-capitalist and revolutionary. But 200 years on from his birth are his ideas still relevant today? We will explore Marx's economic insights for a system in crisis as well as his method for understanding the world today.

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: Climate Change
themes.longDescription: With a climate change denier in the White House and fossil fuel use locked into capitalism - how can we act to stop catastrophic climate change?  We will discuss how Marxist ideas help shed light on an understanding of nature, ecology and the environment.
themes.readMore:
With a climate change denier in the White House and fossil fuel use locked into capitalism - how can we act to stop catastrophic climate change? We will discuss how Marxist ideas help shed light on an understanding of nature, ecology and the environment.

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: Me Too
themes.longDescription: Headlines about the issue of sexual harassment have led to the #MeToo campaign with millions of women sharing their experiences.  There is a growing movement challenging ideas about gender and sexuality. But how can we build a collective response to the sexism structured into our society?
themes.readMore:
Headlines about the issue of sexual harassment have led to the #MeToo campaign with millions of women sharing their experiences. There is a growing movement challenging ideas about gender and sexuality. But how can we build a collective response to the sexism structured into our society?

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: Imperialism
themes.shortDescription: War, imperialism, the Middle East and Palestine
themes.longDescription: From Syria to Palestine the Middle East is on fire  a terrible consequence of western colonialism and imperialism.  We will look at how war is endemic to capitalism, discuss the latest developments in the carve up of the world and crucially ask how we can organise to stop the bloodshed.
themes.readMore:

Please see below all meetings at the conference with this theme :

themes.name: LGBT
themes.shortDescription: Marxism, Trans politics and the fight for LGBT+ liberation
themes.longDescription: There is an offensive against transgender people  with attacks from the right wing media and the tripling of transphobic hate crime in the last five years. Meetings will discuss the fight for LGBT+ liberation, how trans people have fought as part of the wider movement for sexual liberation, and why trans rights are a demand every socialist and trade unionist should support.

themes.name: Trump
themes.shortDescription: Donald Trump, the US and resistance
themes.longDescription: The election as US president of an openly misogynistic, transphobic bigot who built his campaign on racist scapegoating has driven those who want to challenge oppression out onto the streets. We will discuss developments in the US and the potential for resistance to take on Trump.

themes.name: Class
themes.shortDescription: Class, struggle and the trade unions today
themes.longDescription: How can we resist the Tories offensive on working class people? Has the working class lost its power? How should we organise at work? And is there even a future of work or will robots take over? These are just some of the questions we will seek to address at Marxism Festival.

cultureItems.longDescription: Hosted by comedians Johnny Cochrane, Don Biswas and Jasmine Fischer, what better way to gear up for Trump's visit than making jokes at his expense? Friday 8.30pm

cultureItems.name: Calais Children

cultureItems.longDescription: Director Sue Clayton for a Q&A with her award-winning film. Saturday 7pm

cultureItems.name: Black voices
cultureItems.shortDescription: Black voices, white visions: music, racism & identity
cultureItems.longDescription: Musician and author Dave Randall debates anti-racism and music. Sunday 2pm

cultureItems.name: Marxism After Party
cultureItems.longDescription: with music from the Fred Hampton Appreciation Society an eight-piece band based in north-west London who make music to move your head, heart and feet. Sunday 6.30pm

abouts.name: Booking
abouts.text: Advance tickets are cheaper - save money and book online here! You can also book on the phone by calling 0207 840 5620. Book here

abouts.name: Where to find us
abouts.text: The venue for Marxism 2019 is the People's Palace at Queen Mary University, Mile End campus, E1 4NS. The nearest tube is Mile End on the Central Line.

abouts.name: Tickets
abouts.text: Advance bookings finish at 5pm on Wednesday 3 July. If you have not booked an advance ticket you can buy one at the Box Office at the venue which will be open throughout the festival

abouts.name: Disabled access
abouts.text: We make every effort to ensure that Marxism is accessible for disabled people. Our venues are fully accessible.

abouts.name: Accommodation
abouts.text: We can generally arrange free accommodation in London during the event. This is usually "crash pad" type of accommodation on floors and in community centres.
abouts.modalText:
We can generally arrange free accommodation in London during the event. This is usually "crash pad" type of accommodation on floors and in community centres.

Please note that although we try our best to provide free accommodation to all who need it this is NOT guaranteed and we would encourage those who can to make their own arrangements.

.

abouts.name: Crche
abouts.text: We provide a free crche with a range of activities available for children of different ages up to 11 years. This must be booked by Monday 18 June.

abouts.name: Stalls
abouts.text: Many campaigns and activist groups from around the country will be running stalls during the Marxism Festival. Check the website for updates

abouts.name: Bookmarks bookshop
abouts.text: Bookmarks bookshop will be open every day during the Marxism Festival. They will have books by speakers at the event and books that complement meetings and courses.
abouts.modalText:
Liberate your mind

Where do you go when you want to buy a book? A union-busting corporation or a socialist bookshop? Bookmarks is the largest socialist bookshop in Britain.

And we don't just sell from our shop in London, we go out and about to provide bookstalls at events across the country, from Tolpuddle to major demonstrations. We send books across the worldand offer a full mailorder service for individuals and trade unions.

Our range of books covers politics, economics, trade unionism, labour history, the environment, black struggle, women, culture, fiction, radical kid's books and much more. And we don't just sell books, we publish them too- books that answer the big questions that socialists and trade unionists are asking.

The massive anti-union booksellers like Amazon can offer the sorts of discounts smaller shops cannot match. But they do this by attacking their own workers, avoiding corporation tax and squeezing authors and publishers. That's not how we operate. And the major booksellers cannot match the guidance and expertise that our unionised staff provide.

abouts.name: About us
abouts.text: Marxism Festival is a four day political festival of socialist ideas hosted by the Socialist Workers Party.
abouts.modalText:
Marxism Festival is an annual event hosted by the Socialist Workers Party

The Marxism Festival has been taking place for over 30 years. Our aim is to provide a forum to discuss and debate left wing politics involving speakers and activists from different organisations as well as the SWP.

The festival brings together thousands of activists, trade unionists, students, writers and academics from across the globe to grapple with political questions of the day and discuss a way forward in campaigns and struggles.

Find your local SWP branch

Please visit our website

Read Socialist Workers Party publications online
